title: 111_s3355
content: The "Veterans One Source Act of 2010" establishes a one-stop internet website for veterans, their families, and caregivers to access information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities. Congress finds that veterans and their families lack easily accessible information on benefits and resources. The Department of Veterans Affairs aims to modernize and streamline services, including using the internet for outreach to the veteran community. The lack of a comprehensive, user-friendly internet website with all relevant information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities for veterans and their families hinders the seamless transition from military to civilian life. Veterans seek personalized assistance from the Department of Veterans Affairs, which could be supplemented by interactive online services. The Department of Defense has successfully implemented interactive online services for members of the Armed Forces. A consolidated, expanded, and interactive Internet website is proposed for veterans and their families to access information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish an interactive website to provide information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities for veterans and their families. The website will consolidate and improve existing information, and may include additional links as deemed appropriate. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish an interactive website to provide personalized, user-centered Internet experience for veterans and their families. The website may utilize existing resources to avoid duplication of effort and will involve consultation with the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish an interactive website for veterans and their families, involving various federal officials, advisory committees, and other representatives. The website may be registered in the ".com" domain. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a website in the ".com" domain as a one-stop resource for veterans and their families. It will provide information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities including health care, education assistance, housing assistance, and other benefits. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a website in the ".com" domain as a one-stop resource for veterans and their families. It will provide information on various benefits, including veterans benefits, tax benefits, social security benefits, small business administration benefits, and resources such as family support, child care, home care, caregiver support, education resources, stress management, and veterans service organizations. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a website providing resources on stress management, mental health care, veterans service organizations, State and local resources, discounts, volunteer opportunities, community events, and other relevant information. Assistance will be offered in applying for benefits and resources, along with additional benefits, services, and opportunities as deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will incorporate interactive features in the website, including tools for guided navigation, resources for peer-to-peer discussions, information on ride-sharing, memorial notices, internet applications, and other relevant features. Additionally, information on the website will be included in biennial reports on outreach activities. The Department of Veterans Affairs will include plans in biennial reports to enhance their website for better information on benefits and services. The Secretary will describe how the website contributes to outreach activities in the reports.
